fields.description:
{{QueuingIndex}} uses thread interruption to implement cancellation.  The problem is that there is a race condition if the indexer is closed while an index write operation is in progress, as the interrupt causes the underlying index file channels to abort their write operations, leading to corrupt indexes.  See chapter 7 of _Java Concurrency in Practice_ for a detailed description of task cancellation strategies and more information about why using {{interrupt()}} when running other people's code is not a good idea.

This is the underlying culprit in JRA-38544.  As near as I can tell, it has existed since the indexing code was rewritten in JIRA 4.0.  It is normally a very rarely triggered race condition, but especially busy large systems are more likely to encounter it.

Example stack trace:

{noformat}
2014-12-19 18:07:45,525 some-thread-name WARN some-user     [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Indexing failed for Issue - '720151'
2014-12-19 18:07:45,530 some-thread-name WARN some-user     [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] java.nio.channels.ClosedByInterruptException
com.atlassian.jira.util.RuntimeIOException: java.nio.channels.ClosedByInterruptException
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$WriterReference.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:230)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy$2.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy.perform(DefaultIndexEngine.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine.write(DefaultIndexEngine.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex.perform(DefaultIndex.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:130)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)
Caused by: java.nio.channels.ClosedByInterruptException
	at java.nio.channels.spi.AbstractInterruptibleChannel.end(AbstractInterruptibleChannel.java:202)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.map(FileChannelImpl.java:880)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory$MMapIndexInput.<init>(MMapDirectory.java:264)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory.openInput(MMapDirectory.java:216)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.<init>(SegmentCoreReaders.java:85)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:114)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:702)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:677)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3571)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3508)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3371)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3444)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3426)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3410)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:133)
	... 8 more
{noformat}
fields.summary: Lucene index can be corrupted by a graceful shutdown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41408].
  {panel}

When using the various Atlassian products (JIRA, Stash, Bamboo, Confluence) whilst linked to Crowd which is linked to Active Directory on Windows Server 2012 R2, if you rename a user on Active Directory it renames it on Crowd perfectly fine (checked the database itself and it was correct) but it does not rename it on JIRA or Stash correctly. I would assume it does not work correctly on the others as well, but we did not rename any Bamboo users and we installed Confluence after renaming the users.

For example, in my case, my AD name was previously aaron.jenkins. It was renamed to just aaron as a company-wide policy change in naming. Crowd understood this and synchronized it fine, but JIRA instead created a new user called aaron and left the old one, while simultaneously breaking authentication. I have lost the exception, but it was essentially telling me that it found multiple results when looking up a user. It was not until I opened the database in MySQL (whichever version Ubuntu 14.04 comes with) and manually renamed the old users AND deleted the new users it worked.

So, my steps for repairing were

user id 293020: aaron.jenkins
user id 404040: aaron

I had to rename aaron to aaron-, then rename aaron.jenkins to aaron, then delete aaron-. I had to do this in the cwd_user table, the app_user table, and the cwd_membership table.

Version	6.2
Build Number	6252
Build Date	Wed Feb 19 00:00:00 GMT 2014
Build Revision	aa343257d4ce030d9cb8c531be520be9fac1c996

EDIT: this is more of a JIRA issue, I accidentally put it in the Confluence project, sorry.
fields.summary: Improper handling of renaming users when linked to Crowd linked to Active Directory
No priority appears twice when new issue created and priority not set

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Created 1150 projects
* Create Issue button > Click on the dropdown box to select project

Actual Behavior:
* It will load for around 3-4 seconds, quickly display the list but will disappear. 
* But if you press F12, and click on the dropdown box, it will display the list of the projects. 

Expected Behavior:
* It should load the list of the projects as it is working fine in Chrome and Firefox

Additional Information:
* When recording the steps to replicate this problem using "Jing", it is working as expected in IE 11. However, when not using "Jing", the issue is reproducible. There must be something with the Console and Jing which makes it work. 

Videos:
* http://screencast.com/t/htoE3Lx710
* I recorded another video using my mobile phone to describe the difference.
fields.summary: IE 11 Fails to Load Huge Amount of Projects

fields.description:
The Issue Collector cannot be closed when placed inside iframe and also when is created an issue it is not closed. 

This is the same problem reported as JRA-29886 but instead using framesets it is using iframes. That issue was closed because framesets are not longer supported by HTML5 however iframes are supported by HTML5 and this is something that needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Cannot Be Closed When Placed Inside an iframe

fields.description:
When adding a comment to a Jira Bug, pressing 'Esc' causes the dialog to closed without prompting to save ones changes.

This is incredibly frustrating that a product such as this would not protect against this action.  Being a 'vi' user, pressing Esc is automatic and to see two hours of work vaporize leaves me a questioning the maturity and quality of this product.
fields.summary: Pressing 'Esc' closes comment dialog without prompting to save changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41396].
  {panel}

Currently, based on the exported XML of Agile Simplified Workflow, it seems that is missing some Tags that is needed for translating the transition names. This could be compared from the XML tags of the workflow below:
* JIRA Standard Workflow
{code:xml}
<action id="2" name="Close Issue" view="resolveissue">
      <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">closeissue.close</meta>
      <meta name="opsbar-sequence">60</meta>
      <meta name="jira.i18n.description">closeissue.desc</meta>
      <meta name="jira.i18n.title">closeissue.title</meta>
      <!-- ... -->
</action>

<!--...-->

<step id="6" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta>
      <actions>
<common-action id="3" />
      </actions>
    </step>
{code}
* Agile Simplified Workflow
{code:xml}
   <action id="51" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.description">Managed by JIRA Agile</meta>
    </action>
<!-- ...-->
    <step id="6" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta>
    </step>
{code}

The simplified workflow does not have the {{jira.i18n}} which responsible for translation/internationalisation. Hence, it would be great if the same tag will be included as well for Agile Simplified Workflow for translation purposes.
fields.summary: Provide support for translating Agile Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
Taken from JIRA 5.2.11 (donno whether this issue is still present in 6.3/6.4 which is the current last released version/EAP at the time of writing this).

I see a few weird things in the service.bat file shipped with the standalone version of JIRA:
1. rem if not "%JAVA_HOME%" == "" goto gotJdkHome
This line is commented-out. To me it looks like either this was an unintended change, or it was forgotten to adjust the following line/error message:
echo Neither the JAVA_HOME nor the JRE_HOME environment variable is defined

2. set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian JIRA 5.2.11
Given that all following set-calls are quoted, I guess this one should be quotes as well aka:
set "PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian JIRA 5.2.11"
fields.summary: glitches in service.bat

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41388].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If the JIRA WebHook destination connection fails for any reason, such as the below, there will be no errors in the log, so no exceptions - essentially WebHooks fail silently:
 * The domain uses self signed certificate that's not in the Java trust store.
 * There's any other problem with verifying SSL connection (like certificate issued by an unknown CA, protocol/cipher mismatch and so on).
 * The host cannot be reached, due to network configuration.
 * The URL is invalid.

This makes it hard to understand why the connection failed, as nothing is written about the failure.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a WebHook to send to a target that will fail (for example, it uses a self-signed certificate not in the JIRA's trust store, or SSL is configured in a way that will generate an exception, or the URL does not exist).
 # Attempt to send the WebHook by performing the JIRA action that triggers it.
h3. Expected Results


The exception is written to the logs.
h3. Actual Results

No exception is written to the logs or thrown.
h3. Diagnose

Identify why the connection is failing - this can be tested outside of JIRA by using network tools such as {{cURL}}, {{telnet}} and/or {{ping}}. For example, if the target URL is www.example.com/webhook/test/ perform these tests from the JIRA server:
 * If using the {{-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts}} argument, the request may be failing due to JRA-43143 (WebHooks are not respecting this argument).
 * {{ping www.example.com}} to see if the servers can establish a network connection.
 * {{telnet www.example.com 80}} to see if the appropriate port is open.
 * {{curl -X POST www.example.com/webhook/test/}} to see that you can submit a {{POST}} to the target server.

If these tests fail, it can indicate that network / firewall / DNS configurations may need to be addressed, depending upon the errors returned from the different tests.

If this is SSL related, ensure to import the self-signed certificate into the trust store as per [Connecting to SSL services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+SSL+services].

h3. Workaround
# Add the following startup options following the steps on [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver079/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-950289122.html]:
** {{-Djavax.net.debug=ssl}}
** {{-Dssl.debug=true}}
# Restart Jira.
# Change logging level of packages {{com.atlassian.httpclient}} and {{com.atlassian.webhooks}} to DEBUG.

Here's an example of a webhook failing due to a non-existing hostname:

When users migrate from Cloud to Standalone by backing-up their system using the backup manager, the import process is done successfully with no errors on the JIRA Standalone side. However, the information of Mail Servers will not be restored

As you can see in the following screenshot of the Cloud instance, the Mail Servers have information such as Host and username

After migrating, this is what you will see in the Mail Server page

As can be seen, all Mail Server Host is changed to *localhost* while all username are removed.

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Trying to choose date of month May using the Date Picker on Date Picket type Custom Field will prompt you a warning as the following
{quote}Вы не ввели верную дату. Пожалуйста, введите дату в формате "d/MMM/yy", например. "30/дек/14"{quote}
Only occurs when system is using Russian language, or Java is set to use Russian language.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.3.x with Java 8
# Set up JVM arguments as the following in {{setenv.bat/sh}}
{code}set JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=-Duser.language=ru -Duser.country=RU{code}
# Restart JIRA
# Create new Project
# Create new Date Picker custom field
# Choose month of May on the new custom field during issue creation or editing

h4. Actual behaviour
!mayrussian.png!

h4. Expected behaviour
There should not be any issue or warning when choosing the date using the Date Picker for all the months

h4. Workaround
* Manually add the month name as {{мая}} instead of {{май}}
* Use {{-Duser.language=en}} in JVM argument to set default language as English
fields.summary: Date Picker for month May in Russian using Different Language Cases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41377].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA ships with a bundled JRE, which will highly useful does not contain diagnostic tools (such as {{jstack}} / {{jmap}}) that are required for performance troubleshooting, and diagnosing other problems. Admins need to install a JDK to use these tools, which during problematic periods (such as outages) can become a blocker as other teams may maintain servers.

It's a big friction point for customers that we could avoid by providing a JDK that already has those tools.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE.
 
h3. Workaround 

Install a JDK from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html.
fields.summary: JIRA should bundle the Oracle JDK tools

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour:
The API {{projectRoleManager.getProjectRoleActors(projectRole, project)}} is looking for the user at the user_name column of the cwd_user table.
It causes invalid outputs when there is uppercase/lowercase users on it, or renamed users.

eg:

{noformat}
{
    "Administrators": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10002",
    "Developers": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10001",
    "Service Desk Collaborators": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10200",
    "Service Desk Customers": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10100",
    "Service Desk Team": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10101",
    "Tempo Project Managers": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10300",
    "Users": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10000"
}
{
    "actors": [
       
        {
            "avatarUrl": "http://www.gravatar.com/avatar/1ded847651f66eed0a539ea34c6f4727?d=mm&s=16",
            "displayName": "Upper cased 2",
            "id": 10748,
            "name": "uppercaseuser",
            "type": "atlassian-user-role-actor"
        }
    ],
    "description": "A project role that represents administrators in a project",
    "id": 10002,
    "name": "Administrators",
    "self": "http://ironman/jira639/rest/api/2/project/10100/role/10002"
}
{noformat}

h3. Expected behaviour:
It should be looking for the user_key column of the app_user table. So it would be aware of a renamed user, or uppercase/lowercase.
In the example above, it should have returned 'ID20519' instead of 'uppercaseuser'
fields.summary: API 'projectRoleManager.getProjectRoleActors(projectRole, project)' not returning correct user value.

fields.description:
In our documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Priority+Field+Values

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/What+is+an+Issue#WhatisanIssue-Priority
{quote}
Highest — Highest priority. This problem will block progress.
High — Indicates that this issue is causing a problem and requires urgent attention.
Medium — Indicates that this issue has a significant impact.
Low — Indicates that this issue has a relatively minor impact.
Lowest — Lowest priority.
{quote}

Default JIRA values are however :

{quote}
Blocker 	Blocks development and/or testing work, production could not run.		
Critical	Crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak.		
Major		Major loss of function.		
Minor		Minor loss of function, or other problem where easy workaround is present.		
Trivial		Cosmetic problem like misspelt words or misaligned text.
{quote}

This is outdated, please update :)
fields.summary: Priority names in documentation incorrect.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Start JIRA.
# Go to the User Profile page.
# Change the User Language in Preferences to any Language.
# Click Update.

*Expected Result*:
The activity update, words and time in the Activity Stream is changed to the preferred language.

*Actual Results*:
The Activity Update time is not being update while the others are.

*Notes*:
# If the instance is restarted after the language is changed, it will follow the preferred language. But, if the user tries to change it again the update time will behave the same.
# Changing the System Language would not change the Update Time language.
# Editing the Activity Stream in dashboard will change the Update Time Language, but it would not stays when the page is refreshed.
# At some point, when replicating this bug I could make the Update Time in activity stream different between each other (Project Summary, User Profile, Dashboard).

*Workaround*:
The only workaround that I could find is to restart JIRA while in the preferred language.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Update Time Language Does not Change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41368].
  {panel}

h4. +Steps to reproduce:+
# log in JIRA
# browse a project -> Administration panel
#* or JIRA Administration -> Projects -> any project
# go to Development tools
# click Refresh (to refresh connected applications)

h4. +Expected behavior:+
The application list is refreshed properly

h4. +Actual behavior:+
The Refresh button runs very shortly or almost does not run
-> Nothing happens
-> The list is not refreshed

h4. +Workaround:+
In order for the Refresh button to run properly, users needs Administration Access. In other words, users need to go to a different Administration Section first e.g. Issues, Add-ons, System in order to be prompted for Administration Access login. Only then can they go back to Development tools and Refresh the applications.

h4. +Suggestion:+
Implement the Administration Access prompt when users Refresh Development tools
fields.summary: Prompt for Administration Access when Refreshing Development tools

For example, the *? > Keyboard Shortcuts* screenshot isn't up to date. The newer pop up dialog contains an *Issue Action* section.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41358].
  {panel}

When using the "@mention" if you hit Enter, the highlighted suggestion would auto-complete.  Now we are on JIRA 6.2.1 and you have to mouse-click the highlighted row for the @mention to commit.  IE10, Firefox and Chrome all display this behaviour.

h4. +Answer+
This issue is caused by Zephyr plugin. Temporarily disabling the plugin will get the Mention feature to work properly again with pressing Enter.

Currently this issue is being tracked by Zephyr in their internal project. For more information, you can contact Zephyr support and mention the issue key *ZFJ-1331* to them.

h4. +Workaround+
Thanks to everyone's feedback, a Mouse Click or pressing Tab is able to select the mentioned user instead of pressing Enter.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41353].
  {panel}

In order to keep the number of custom fields under control, we ask our admins to reuse fields as much as possible, creating new contexts when a field's values need to be specific for a project.

Most of the time however, the same context will be shared by a group of projects belonging to the same team/department.

It would be extremely useful to be able to create a context scheme, to be able to quickly assign a group of context without having to edit each custom field one by one.

I think one context scheme per project is good enough for most situations.

Not sure if this fits within JRA-3156 or not.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41336].
  {panel}

When a Pie Chart gadget is used to display on custom fields values it incorrectly handles "Other".

Example: We have a field called "Issue Category" and one of the user select-able options is called "Other". When the chart is rendered its results are ambiguous (see attached) including the results in both "Other" (a user entry) and in the automatically summarized field "Other" containing the remaining entries of smaller quantity. Clicking on this auto-generated "Other" however does not include the user selected "Other" entries.

I propose that it would be more clear if the auto-generated summation on the pie chart called "Other" should not include any user entries that may also by chance be called "Other". Perhaps an even better approach would be to name this auto-generated summation something that is not likely to be used as a user selectable entry but still gets the point across that these are an automatically generated summary of the remaining entries.

For example, name the other entries as "Other Entries" or "Other Choices".
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
h3. Expected behavior
Users are able to login with LDAP password after being migrated from an Internal Directory to a Delegated LDAP, regardless of already being present in the target directory or not.

h3. Actual behavior
Users are either presented with a 500 error on the browser when trying to login or are unable to get past the login screen at all.

In the former scenario, when expanding details of the error, the below stack trace is seen on the browser and nothing is thrown at the logs.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user on the internal directory with the same name as an LDAP user;
# Create a directory of type *Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication* with the "Copy user on login" option *unchecked*;
# Migrate users from the default *Internal Directory* to the Delegated one;
(i) Users can login successfully with LDAP password.
# Edit the Delegated directory to "Copy user on login";
(!) Problem occurs.

h3. Environment
* Able to reproduce with AD, but *not* with OpenLDAP;

h3. Resolution
(!) _This workaround involves manual manipulation of the JIRA's database, please perform any change on a test environment first before applying into production and make sure to have an up-to-date backup._
# Stop JIRA;
# Get the directory's ID;
{code:sql}
SELECT id AS "ID", directory_name AS "Name" FROM cwd_directory WHERE directory_type = DELEGATING;
{code}
# Remove the value for {{external_id}} of the migrated users directly on the {{cwd_user}} table in JIRA's database;
#* For MySQL and PostgreSQL
{code:sql}
UPDATE cwd_user SET external_id = '' WHERE directory_id = <directory-id>
{code}
#* For SQL Server:
{code:sql}
UPDATE cwd_user SET external_id = NULL WHERE directory_id = <directory-id>
{code}
# Restart JIRA;
fields.summary: Migrated users that already existed on LDAP directory are unable to login

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41331].
  {panel}

To duplicate this bug:
# Create custom field "ABC".
# Configure it so it is specific to project "X", Issue Type "Y".
# Create issues in project X, issue type Y, with some values in field ABC.
# Create issues in project X, issue type Y, without any value in field ABC.
# Create filter "project = X" and save it as "Filter DEF".
# In Issue Navigator, add Column "ABC".
# Save filter.
# Reload filter.
# What is *Expected*: ABC is saved the filter DEF and appears as a column in the filter result.
# What is *Observed*: ABC is not saved in the filter DEF. No ABC column in the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Issue Type and Project specific custom field cannot be saved with filter
Comments should be editable/deletable for closed issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41328].
  {panel}


https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options

This documentation should mention in the *Mode* section that setting the *-Private-* mode will not prevent users to be created by other user directories.

EG: A JIRA Administrator set JIRA Mode private, now users can't sign up, however, if JIRA has an LDAP directory with delegated authentication configured, the user is able to login and create a new account if the directory has the option "Copy user" enable.

This documentation leads to believe that Users can't create new accounts without specifying that they can if LDAP is configured.
fields.summary: Configuring JIRA Options documentation should be updated.
Deleting User is not deleting the User data in the APP_USER table

fields.description:
Jira displays charts on the dashboard by writting a temporary file in Jira "tmp" folder and reading it through a page called "charts"
When the filename provided to this page is not present, an error message displays the full path to the "tmp" folder, which lies in Jira directory.
This is a vulnerability.
fields.summary: Information disclosure - full path disclosure
Project enumeration through bruteforce attack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41324].
  {panel}

When trying to profile performance issues with VisualVM, the natural problem is the OSGi class loader isolation. To overcome this problem, the Felix container allows to define a set of packages for boot delegation.
Currently, the default system property for Felix is ignored and an Atlassian specific one is used. The default for this property contains packages for several profiler (e.g. JProfiler and YoutKit) but does not contain the ones needed for VisualVM.
Please add them to ease profiling with VisualVM. Please feel free to request further information or suggestions in case you feel uncertain.

The required packages are: 
* org.netbeans.lib.profiler.server,org.netbeans.lib.profiler.server.*
fields.summary: Add packages for VisualVM to default Boot Delegation Configuration

h3. +Workaround:+
# Download [^workflow-designer-plugin-6.2.0-m5-379.jar] (this is the version bundled in JIRA 6.2 rc1).
# Navigate to *Administration » Add-ons » Manage Add-ons*,
# and click on *'Upload Add-on'*.
# Select the downloaded file and upload it.

After that the workflow should be displayed correctly. Please note though the attached file is a milestone release, and therefore it's possible it contains bugs, specially with JIRA 6.1. To actually fix this problem, please upgrade to JIRA 6.2 as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Workflow Designer doesn't work after migrating from OnDemand - after 6.2 fix version.

fields.description:
History tab shows wrong user for the creation event under these circumstances:

- issue is created by incoming email 
- sender is not a jira user, making "default email reporter" as reporter

Reporter of issue is set correctly to "default email reporter", but in history tab a random user as it seems shows up as the one creating it. The same user seems to be used for all the tickets for the same project. 

We are in fact using JETI plugin, so I'm not sure on where the problem is.
fields.summary: History tab showing wrong user for create event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41321].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When using JIRA with JAVA 1.8 (and using it in a non-English language), JIRA might not recognize the dates properly, even when they are set according to the date picker format

h3. Steps to replicate

# Setup JIRA with JAVA 1.8 (preferable JIRA 6.3 and above)
# Set JIRA to use one of the affected languages (more on that later). For now we shall use German
# Set the due date to be in March
# The result is as follows :
!german lang.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* This does not seem to be able to be replicated if using JAVA 1.7 or below
* Another affected language found so far is Czech :
!czech lang.png|thumbnail!
* This seems to only affect certain months/patterns (for example, using the German language example above, March is affected, but not December)
* Tested in JIRA 6.3.9 with Postgres

*Possible Workaround:*
- Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}

- For Cloud instances, kindly create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com/ to perform the above workaround.
fields.summary: JAVA 8 in JIRA does not recognize some dates set in foreign language

fields.description:
h4. Summary:
*How mail handler normally works:*
# detect the email in the inbox
# create issue
# if it detects attachment, it will try to add the attachment to the issue
# once the attachment was successfully added, delete the email from inbox

*How it works here (happens occasionally):*
When the attachment was not added successfully, the same email stays in the inbox. This cause the mail handler to re-process the email and re-create an issue again out of it

h4. Steps to reproduce:
This is not reproducible.

h4. Error causing the email not being deleted (failed to add the attachment):
{code}
2014-12-11 19:58:57,489 QuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    XX.YYYY [mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.3] Checking if attachment should be added to issue:
2014-12-11 19:58:57,489 QuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    XX.YYYY [mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.3] 	Content-Type: image/png; name="XYXY.png"
2014-12-11 19:58:57,490 QuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    XX.YYYY [mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.3] 	Content-Disposition: attachment
2014-12-11 19:58:57,491 QuartzScheduler_Worker-3 ERROR ServiceRunner    XX.YYYY [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] XX.YYYY[XYXYX]: Exception: null
java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException
	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.png.PNGImageReader.readMetadata(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.png.PNGImageReader.getImageMetadata(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.GeneratedAttachmentRecogniser.containsJiraMetadata(GeneratedAttachmentRecogniser.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.GeneratedAttachmentRecogniser.<init>(GeneratedAttachmentRecogniser.java:32)
	at 
{code}

h4. Suggestion
If deleting the unsuccessfully processed email is not an option (perhaps for integrity reason), then maybe mail handler could mark it as *read* and notify the reporter to resend an email for creating issue (while the read email will not be processed anymore).
fields.summary: Duplicate Issues Created by Mail Handler When Attachment is not processed correctly

fields.description:
h5. Summary
Large instances of JIRA will experience performance problems when a query for a project share is constructed (this is used for example to share saved filters on a view rapid board screen). The impact will be higher in proportion to quantity of projects and associations between users and roles (role actors).

h5. Cause 
The way we are checking whether the user has rights to view saved filters is highly inefficient and may cause performance problems on large instances (big number of projects and roles) resulting in a lot of database queries when JIRA's caches are cold.

h5. Notes
One workaround for this issue is to keep the caches warm by running a curl script for example every 15 minutes. Example url: https://host:port/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/config.json?returnDefaultBoard=false&rapidViewId=idOfSomeBoard
fields.summary: PermissionQueryFactory can cause performance issues when JIRA's caches are cold

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41315].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have been transitioning our Jira integration scripts over to the new
REST API, as Atlassian indicated that they will be phasing SOAP out in
future releases.

One feature that is sorely lacking in the REST API is the ability to
make changes to a ticket without triggering email notifications:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34423

Can you please look into this on HIGH priority?
fields.summary: REST API is the ability to make changes to a ticket without triggering email notifications
The Rapid Upgrade documentation should clearly explain how to migrate customisations
Issue Activity should show only information from Linked Pages when using Project Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41310].
  {panel}

JIRA has two settings that make some or all of an issue read-only:

* A Version is Archived (issues with that Version set in a field cannot have that Version removed from the field).
* The Workflow step has the {{jira.issue.editable}} property set to {{false}} (the entire issue is read-only).

While these are good controls to apply to general users, there are always exceptions, where issue attributes need some clean-up after the "read-only" settings have been applied.  For example, an older issue with an archived Version is resurrected, or a "closed" issue needs some data clean-up for accurate metrics.

At present, there is no way to override these read-only states...the only way to deal with "clean-up" situations is to undo the read-only state (e.g. un-archive the Version or temporarily remove the {{jira.issue.editable}} setting).  Both of these require administrator permissions (either Project or System), and this adds to the administrative workload.

This request is for a capability to define the users/groups/roles that are allowed to "override" these read-only settings.  This would allow JIRA administrators to share the workload a little more with the user community (e.g. allowing users with a privileged project role to edit read-only issues in that project).  Making this configurable per instance will enable this capability while still respecting the specific data integrity requirements of each instance.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of users who can override two read-only settings, to lighten administrative workload

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41309].
  {panel}

It seems that there is a minor bug in the date picker in the german version.
The month march is translated "März" in german. The Datepicker generates the following format, if you pick a day in march:
7/Mrz/15 (See attachment 1)
This leads to an error (See attachment 2)

The workarround is to set the format manually in the following way
7/Mär/14
fields.summary: Datepicker

h4. +Steps to Replicate+
# In JIRA Cloud (6.4.x), create a custom workflow in Diagram mode
# Back up JIRA Cloud and import into JIRA Server
# View the custom workflow created above in Diagram mode (in JIRA Server)

h4. +Expected Behavior+
The workflow should be displayed properly without any error

h4. +Actual Behavior+
The workflow is not displayed and the following error: "An error occurred while loading the workflow. See your system log for more information." is shown:
!error.png|thumbnail!

This same error is observed in a couple of places:
* Project Administration -> Issue Types -> <any_issue_type>
* Project Administration -> Workflows -> <view_diagram_mode>
* JIRA Administration -> Issues -> Workflows -> <view_diagram_mode>
* View Issue screen -> View Workflow

# Download [^workflow-designer-plugin-6.4-D20141201T055222.jar] (this is the version bundled in JIRA Server 6.4-m12)
# Navigate to *Administration » Add-ons » Manage Add-ons*
# Click *'Upload Add-on'*
# Select the downloaded file and upload it
After that the workflow should be displayed correctly.

{panel}(i) Apart from this, administrators can still view and edit the affected workflow in Text mode from JIRA Administration -> Issues -> Workflows{panel}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41303].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
When changing the issue type of an issue. If you have assigned a custom field to an issue type, which do not exist in your new issue type. When you do custom field value search the issue still shows in issue navigator. 


h3. Feature Request
When changing the issue type of an issue. If you have assigned a custom field to an issue type, which do not exist in your new issue type. When you do custom field value search the issue should not show in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Custom field value search should not include the issue that previously had the custom field value before changing the issue type

fields.description:
If a user is deactivated, which means it belongs to no existing group in JIRA, it is still able to be set as an issue watcher if it has the Browser Project Permission.

Steps to replicate:

# deactivate an user.
# ensure it has Browse Project permission.
# try to add it as watcher in any existing issue on the project it has the permission to browse.

The issue has been addressed in JRA-27453, but is not solved in JIRA v6.2.3#6260
fields.summary: Deactivated user is allowed to be added as watcher in v6.2.3#6260
Cannot create Sprints as a person in a project admin role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41298].
  {panel}

Referencing our documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Emailing+an+Issue#EmailinganIssue-sharing

JIRA allows users to be linked to an issue even if users don't have adequate project permissions (browse projects) to access the issue. 

The notification is sent but can create confusing in that it says that an issue has been shared with them, but when they click the link, it says they don't have permissions to the issue.

The suggestion is that the process gets renamed to just say Notify Users or similar and reword the e-mail to the users so it is less confusing.

Additionally,  it would be nice if the share dialog box tool would honor the carriage returns in the note. When sending a note like this:
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
...when it gets sent to the recipient(s), it appears actually will appear like this:
Line 1 Line 2 Line 3

Which makes it difficult to read lists of data like usernames/passwords, especially when they are multiple recipients.
fields.summary: Share Issue is confusing for users without the Browse Project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41297].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the ability to disable attachments globally in a JIRA Cloud instance - this is currently not possible because it is a [Restricted Function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Restricted+Functions#RestrictedFunctions-JIRA] in Atlassian Cloud.

!attachments.png!

*Workaround*

Ensure that users don't have the *Create Attachments* permission (located inside the permission scheme) for all projects.
fields.summary: Ability to disable attachments globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41293].
  {panel}

Links from JIRA in Activity Stream/Gadgets (this includes other Atlassian products like Confluence) always use relative URLs (/foo/bar) instead of absolute URLs (http://www.example.com/foo/bar). When a user in a different application (Confluence) clicks a link in the Activity Stream/Gadgets generated by JIRA it will give them a 404 not found error (since it will try to load the relative URL in the Confluence base URL).

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install JIRA and Confluence (tested with JIRA 6.2.2, 6.3.12, 7.11.2 and Confluence 5.5.3, 5.6.5,6.10.2)
# Setup an Application Link between the two
# Subscribe to JIRA gadgets in Confluence
** This allows you to use the JIRA activity stream gadget
# Create test data in JIRA
# Create a page in Confluence with the JIRA activity stream
# Click the JIRA links that are shown in the stream

h3. Expected behavior
Click the link takes you to the item in JIRA

h3. Actual behavior
The standard Confluence Page not found error or a blank page

h3. Screenshot
The following screenshot shows the relative link in the JIRA activity stream, and what happens when you click the link in an Activity Stream in Confluence:
!activity_stream.png|thumbnail!!failed_link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Links from JIRA Use Relative URLs for Activity Stream/Gadgets
Sharing Issue should get recorded in History/Activity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41290].
  {panel}

The Contact Site Administrators Form in JIRA is shown as below:
!site.png|thumbnail!

Some people prefer not to have the form fields (such as To, From, Subject, Request Details) as they could put the *link to their contact form* on the *Contact Administrator Message* box (shown in the screenshot above).

It'll be great to have the feature to disable/modify the built-in form.
fields.summary: Option to Allow JIRA System Administrator to modify Contact Site Administrators Form
webcam field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41288].
  {panel}

During the JIRA setup process on stable we have a screen that attempts to capture some info through use of survey questions.
These aren't needed anymore, so we need to get rid of them. 

This incorporates a couple of things:
- remove the call to get the questions from hamlet
- remove the submission of the question responses to hamlet
- remove any code processing the questions, checkboxes etc

This code lives in the setup-license.js file I believe.
fields.summary: Remove the survey questions from the setup process on stable
